results.title: Choosing for happiness
results.creator_credit: Willard Van Dyke, Irving Jacoby and McGraw-Hill Films
results.brief_description: Based on the texts by Henry A. Bowman, this instructional piece, for young women, is about choosing the right lifemate. The film focuses on Eve, a college student, attractive and full of life but mysteriously single. Flash-backs follow and show why. Eve’s failure, according to this film is due to the fact that her choices never match up to her criteria: “Is he right for me?” But with the help of her friend Mary, she learns that: “You can’t make over a man like you do a room.” But she still ends up without a boyfriend. Unintentionally hilarious.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Willard Van Dyke, Irving Jacoby and McGraw-Hill Films

results.title: Choosing a leader
results.creator_credit: Julia Murphy, Nicholas Balla and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode number 10 of Series “What Do You Think”.
An open-ended discussion film for teenaged groups dealing with the problem of choosing a leader. The story concerns a group of boys and girls hiking in the woods, facing the possibility of being lost. One boy, always highly admired because of his athletic prowess, wants to take one direction; another boy, with considerable logic on his side, wants to take the other. What are the factors the group must take into consideration in deciding whose leadership to choose? The question is left with the film audience.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Julia Murphy, Nicholas Balla and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Choosing a dog
results.creator_credit: Frank Gardner and Central Office of Information
results.brief_description: A film survey of British bred dogs. The salient physical and mental characteristics of different breeds are examined and appealing portraits of canine favourites appear on the screen. A more serious activity of these animals - their invaluable services as guide dogs to the blind - is also illustrated.

results.title: The Choice
results.creator_credit: Gordon Begg, Imperial Chemical Industries and Millbank Films
results.brief_description: Surveys the results of pollution by all kinds of waste products in the natural environment: air, water and land, and discusses the counter-measures and better disposal methods being used. Stresses the need for industry, commerce, individuals and the community to be prepared to take action.

results.title: The Choice
results.brief_description: The staff of a high school newspaper decide to do an issue on the drug problem, by dividing into two groups to research the pros and cons of drug taking. Projects the message that before a choice is made in favour of the non-medical use of drugs one should be fully aware of the dangers to mental and physical health inherent in such a choice. Intended mainly for school children. NOTE: Restricted to tertiary institutions, teaching hospitals, police and customs departments.

results.title: The Choice is yours
results.brief_description: Very explicitly the film explains the causes, symptoms, possible effects and treatment of gonorrhea and syphilis, and how it differs between men and women. Suggestions are made on precautions to take, and it is pointed out that unlike most other diseases the contracting of these is absolutely up to the individual and early VD can be cured quite simply.

results.title: The Choice is yours (Industrial safety)
results.creator_credit: Colin Fox, Erika Hellfritsch, John Ward, Ken Daley and Drayton Film Productions
results.brief_description: Considers the problems of industrial safety on civil engineering construction sites. Makes the point that it is not the obviously risky jobs and locations that cause the majority of accidents but simple carelessness. Reconstructs accidents, and stresses the value of goggles.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Colin Fox, Erika Hellfritsch, John Ward, Ken Daley and Drayton Film Productions

results.title: The choice is yours
results.brief_description: Instructional film concerning water pollution and prevention. Appreciation for our water resources is stimulated first by tranquil scenes of nature as it was before the coming of man, then by exciting scenes featuring the many forms of water recreation man enjoys today. In stark contrast.. the diastrous effects of pollution. In the laboratories of a water resources commission the complexity of the problem is discussed and the procedures of water management agencies are described. The film ends with a dramatic abstract sequence where the choice between pure or polluted water is again presented, thus encouraging serious discussion of this vital part of our environment.

results.title: Chiostri e cortili
results.creator_credit: Ubaldo Magnachi and Istuto Nazionale Luce
results.brief_description: An exploration of the architectural beauty and historical associations of cloisters and courtyards in and around Rome. Includes views of San Giovanni in Lateran, Santa Maria del Angeli and some of the work of Michelangelo. Commentary is in Italian.

results.title: Chinese shadow play
results.creator_credit: Wan-go Wen and China Film Enterprises of America
results.brief_description: The shadow-play is one of the most popular Chinese folk-arts; it appeared in China during the 10th century A.D. this film presents a shortened version of the traditional tale of the White Snake Lady, one of the most popular of all Chinese fairy tales. The figures are made from translucent parchment, (in China, from donkey skin) which is painted in delicate colors, and to which wires for manipulation are attached. The drama is performed by manipulating the figures behind an illuminated screen, to the accompaniment of Chinese drums, gongs, and cymbals; the melodramatic dialogue is spoken from behind the screen by the manipulators. Animation and demonstration by Pauline Benton. Narrated by Arvo Wirta.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Wan-go Wen and China Film Enterprises of America
